message.content:
To create a plot comparing two columns in a DataFrame, you can use the matplotlib library in Python. Here's an example:

```python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Create a sample dataframe
df = pd.DataFrame({
    'x': [1, 2, 3, 4, 5],
    'y': [6, 7, 8, 9, 10],
    'z': [11, 12, 13, 14, 15]
})

# Plot column 'x' against column 'y' and column 'x' against column 'z' in the same figure
fig, ax = plt.subplots()
ax.plot(df['x'], df['y'], label='Column y')
ax.plot(df['x'], df['z'], label='Column z')
ax.legend()
ax.set_title('Comparison of columns y and z')
ax.set_xlabel('X values')
ax.set_ylabel('Y values')
plt.show()
```

This code will create a plot comparing the 'y' column with the 'z' column in the DataFrame, both plotted against the 'x' column. You can replace 'x', 'y', and 'z' with the names of your columns to compare them in your dataframe.
